result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert H Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay $100 fine plus costs, including Court-appointed attorney fees upon Court's approval of attorney fee bill. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.  Defendant can petition for early termination of probation after 8 months if all conditions, including payment of all financial obligations, have been completed and with recommendation of Dept. of Corrections. Submit DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: Stayed, to be used at discretion of Court through petition of Dept. of Corrections.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert H Peterson

defendant.name: Peterson, Robert H
defendant.address: 1547 Egg Harbor Road #8, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: for Early Discharge from probation pursuant to Sec. 973.09(3)(d)

Defendant Robert H Peterson in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty. State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defendant is working at Therm-Tron-X through Superior Resources

Defendant Robert H Peterson in court with attorney Travis A. Crowell. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defense enters not guilty plea. Bond continues as is.  Status conference scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Atty Crowell contacted the Court, is not available on 10/22/15. Case rescheduled to 11/23/15, 10:00.
Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Robert H Peterson appeared by video conference. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return 10/22/15, 10:30.
Court appoints Travis Crowell, orders Defendant to pay $150 per month starting 11/13/15.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency
